Add an emoji reaction to a message.
Send approval message to a user and then: Send approval message to a user and then wait until the message is approved or disapproved
Send approval message to a channel and t: Send approval message to a channel and then wait until the message is approved or disapproved
Send a message to a user and wait until: Send a message to a user and wait until the user selects an action
Send a message in a channel and wait unt: Send a message in a channel and wait until an action is selected
Upload file without sharing it to a chan: Upload file without sharing it to a channel or user
Return information about a given file ID: Return information about a given file ID.
Searches for messages matching a query: Searches for messages matching a query
Finds a user by matching against their e: Finds a user by matching against their email address.
Finds a user by matching against their S: Finds a user by matching against their Slack handle.
Finds a user by their ID.
List all users of the workspace: List all users of the workspace
Update basic profile field such as name: Update basic profile field such as name or title.
Retrieve all messages from a specific ch: Retrieve all messages from a specific channel ("conversation") between specified timestamps
Convert Markdown-formatted text to Slack: Convert Markdown-formatted text to Slack's pseudo - markdown syntax
Retrieves thread messages by channel and: Retrieves thread messages by channel and thread timestamp.
Sets the topic on a selected channel.
Retrieves a specific message from a chan: Retrieves a specific message from a channel history using the message's timestamp.
Invites an existing User to an existing: Invites an existing User to an existing channel.
Make a custom API call to a specific end: 将一个自定义 API 调用到一个特定的终点
Title: 标题
\n\tPlease make sure add the bot to the:
Please make sure add the bot to the channel by following these steps:
	  1. Type /invite in the channel's chat.
	  2. Click on Add apps to this channel.
	  3. Search for and add the bot.
  
**Note**: If you can't find the channel in the dropdown list (which fetches up to 2000 channels), please click on the **(F)** and type the channel ID directly.
You can get the Channel ID by right-clic: You can get the Channel ID by right-clicking on the channel and selecting 'View Channel Details.'
Please provide the timestamp of the mess: Please provide the timestamp of the message you wish to react, such as `1710304378.475129`. Alternatively, you can easily obtain the message link by clicking on the three dots next to the message and selecting the `Copy link` option.
The profile picture of the bot: The profile picture of the bot
Provide the ts (timestamp) value of the: Provide the ts (timestamp) value of the **parent** message to make this message a reply. Do not use the ts value of the reply itself; use its parent instead. For example `1710304378.475129`.Alternatively, you can easily obtain the message link by clicking on the three dots next to the parent message and selecting the `Copy link` option.
When replying to a thread, also make the: When replying to a thread, also make the message visible to everyone in the channel (only applicable when Thread Timestamp is provided)
You can pass the file ID from the New Me: You can pass the file ID from the New Message Trigger payload.
User handle (display name), without the: User handle (display name), without the leading @
Please provide the timestamp of the mess: Please provide the timestamp of the message you wish to update, such as `1710304378.475129`. Alternatively, you can easily obtain the message link by clicking on the three dots next to the message and selecting the `Copy link` option.
The updated text of your message: The updated text of your message
Changing a user's email address will sen: Changing a user's email address will send an email to both the old and new addresses, and also post a slackbot message to the user informing them of the change.
ID of user to change. This argument may: ID of user to change. This argument may only be specified by admins on paid teams.You can use **Find User by Email** action to retrieve ID.
Only messages after this timestamp will: Only messages after this timestamp will be included in results
Only messages before this timestamp will: Only messages before this timestamp will be included in results. Default is the current time
Include messages with oldest or latest t: Include messages with oldest or latest timestamps in results. Ignored unless either timestamp is specified
Return all metadata associated with each: Return all metadata associated with each message
Emoji shortname (standard or custom), e.g. :tada: or :train:
Unix timestamp - if not set, the status: Unix timestamp - if not set, the status will not expire
Provide the ts (timestamp) value of the: Provide the ts (timestamp) value of the **parent** message to retrieve replies of this message. Do not use the ts value of the reply itself; use its parent instead. For example `1710304378.475129`.Alternatively, you can easily obtain the message link by clicking on the three dots next to the parent message and selecting the `Copy link` option.
Please provide the timestamp of the mess: Please provide the timestamp of the message you wish to retrieve, such as `1710304378.475129`. Alternatively, you can easily obtain the message link by clicking on the three dots next to the message and selecting the `Copy link` option.
Authorization headers are injected autom: 授权头自动从您的连接中注入。
Enable for files like PDFs, images, etc..
Use user token instead of bot token: Use user token instead of bot token
HEAD: 黑色
Triggers when a new message is posted to: Triggers when a new message is posted to any channel.
Triggers when a new message is posted to a specific #channel you choose.
Triggers when a message was posted in a: Triggers when a message was posted in a direct message channel.
Triggers when a username is mentioned.
Triggers when a username is mentioned in: Triggers when a username is mentioned in a direct message channel.
Triggers when a new reaction is added to: Triggers when a new reaction is added to a message
Triggers when a channel is created: Triggers when a channel is created
Triggers when a specific command is sent: Triggers when a specific command is sent to the bot (e.g., @bot command arg1 arg2)
Triggers when a specific command is sent to the bot (e.g., @bot command arg1 arg2) via Direct Message.
Triggers when a new user is created / fi: Triggers when a new user is created / first joins your org.
Triggers when you save a message.
Triggers when a custom emoji has been ad: Triggers when a custom emoji has been added to a team.
\n\tPlease make sure add the bot to the:
Please make sure add the bot to the channel by following these steps:
	  1. Type /invite in the channel's chat.
	  2. Click on Add apps to this channel.
	  3. Search for and add the bot.
  
**Note**: If you can't find the channel in the dropdown list (which fetches up to 2000 channels), please click on the **(F)** and type the channel ID directly in an array like this: `{`{ ['your_channel_id_1', 'your_channel_id_2', ...] `}`}
If no channel is selected, the flow will: If no channel is selected, the flow will be triggered for username mentions in all channels
List of valid commands that the bot shou: List of valid commands that the bot should respond to (e.g., help, ocr, remind)
If no channel is selected, the flow will: If no channel is selected, the flow will be triggered for commands in all channels
